Key Match Events: Shaedon Sharpe's put-back slam dunk with 5:26 left in the game put Portland up 91-83, sending the home crowd into a frenzy.
Others: The teams entered the fourth quarter tied before Portland took control behind the defense of Donovan Clingan, who had four blocks in the period as Minnesota missed 10 of its first 11 shots to start the final frame.
Minnesota shot 7 for 39 (18%) from the 3-point line. The Wolves entered Wednesday ranked fourth in the NBA in 3-point percentage.
